clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Validation Trial of a Single-use Bronchoscope (Ambu® aScope ™ 4)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Validation Trial of the Single-use Bronchoscope Ambu® aScope ™ 4

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the usefulness of the new Ambu® aScope ™ 4 bronchoscope, in the usual practice of low complexity diagnostic bronchoscopy managed by bronchoscopists who meet the minimum training requirements (having performed 100 supervised procedures [ 10]) and maintenance of competition (with more than 25 bronchoscopies per year [10]).

detailed_description.textblock:
Muticentric trial to evaluate three outcomes
1. Describe the experience of bronchoscopists performing low complexity bronchoscopic procedures with the Ambu® aScope ™ 4.
2. Collect the opinion of bronchoscopists about the technical characteristics of the device subject to study through a standardized questionnaire.
3. Analyze the quality of both microbiological and cytological samples obtained through the disposable bronchoscope.

primary_outcome.description: - A numeric scale describes the experience of bronchoscopists performing low complexity bronchoscopic procedures with the Ambu® aScope ™ 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: -Opinion of the operator -Quality of the sample
secondary_outcome.description: 1.A numeric scale collects the opinion of bronchoscopists about the technical characteristics of the device subject to study through a standardized questionnaire.
2.Analyze the quality of both microbiological and cytological samples obtained through the disposable bronchoscope describing the diagnostic yield.

arm_group.description: Bronchoscopies performed in different sites to evaluate the level of satisfaction of the operators with the device Ambu® aScope™ 4

study_pop.textblock: - Patients that require a low complexity bronchoscopy that accept the informed consent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low complexity bronchoscopies in patients that need to undergo a low complexity bronchoscopy in the sites of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- No acceptance of the informed consent
- Any procedure out of a low complexity bronchoscopy in the sites of the study
